entry.title: New release for Overr-Syncerr: v1.0.6.2
entry.content:
What's new

  • Subtitles: set preferred subtitles for users similar to how you would set preferred audio tracks. (language, codec, forced/non-forced). A user_subs_pref.json file will be generated upon the first boot with a basic config for each user. Preferred subtitles will be applied upon media availability.

Example:

{ "Bob": { "preferred": [ { "forced": true, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "eng" } ], "fallback": { "codec": "srt", "forced": false } }

Fixes & Improvements

  • Add Label: label can now be added on media that has multiple versions in one library (1080p, 2160p, etc); would originally throw an error
  • Set Audio Track: switched from language to languageCode for the matching the preferred tracks as it's more accurate. If running an older version, change 'language' to 'languageCode' and change the name of the language to the corresponding 3-letter ISO 639 language code (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) in the user_audio_pref.json

WIP

  • Request Monitor: it's recommended to keep it disabled as enabling it will cause an infinite loop of applying audio tracks.

Future Plans (To-Do)

  • Revamp the subtitle management part of OS so that it is more intuitive and easier to use - no ETA

entry.title: New release for Overr-Syncerr: v1.0.6.3
entry.content:
What's new

  • Improved Subtitle Path Handling (GPT): fixed an issue that was causing problems when mapping the Movie and TV mappings in Linux-based systems, and would result in 'subtitle path doesn't exists' error. ( #24 )
  • Handle Null/Library IDs: the script will now continue to work if no library names have been specified in the docker-compose; this will only allow for subtitle management as setting labels, audio track and subtitles require the present of library IDs. This makes it so you can run the script if you're using Jellyfin for managing subtitles via Jellyseerr. ( #25 )

WIP

  • Monitor Requests: keep disabled as it's not fully functioning.

entry.title: New release for Overr-Syncerr: v1.0.6.4
entry.content:
What's new?

  • Set default variables + better error handling to prevent excessive logging ( #26 )
  • Updated docker image to support multiple platforms ( #28 )
  • Updated GPT translation functions
  • Added Sonarr webhook support - receive payloads from Sonarr to trigger subtitle and audio track preferences logic (partially available seasons/series) Enable by adding OS webhook URL to your Sonarr instance in Settings -> Connect -> Webhook -> URL and enable only 'On Import Complete', method should be POST
  • Updated Overseerr Request Monitor function

New variables

Add these two variables to your docker-compose: SONARR_EP_TRACKING: "false" #Enable to use Sonarr webhook; disables TV logic from being executed via Media Available SONARR_TRACK_DELAY_SECONDS: 12 #Delay (in seconds) before triggering audio and subtitle track preferences to ensure that Plex metadata is refreshed

Overseerr Request Monitor

When enabled, OS will scan all requests made in Overseerr/Jellyseerr and handle the ones that are available and partially available, which will: add label, set preferred audio and subtitle tracks to those media items. This function will run only once in the beginning of the script unless rebooted or set to 'false'. I recommend running it once to process all your old media and then setting it to false.

Sonarr Webhook

Usage of this webhook will enable OS to set preferred audio and subtitle tracks for series that are labeled as "partially available" or "incomplete" due to missing episodes. When a new episode becomes available, OS will do its thing. Enabling this will disable the tv processing logic when media becomes available to avoid media reprocessing.

entry.title: New release for Overr-Syncerr: v1.0.6.5
entry.content:
What's New

  • Support for Plex webhook for applying audio & subtitle tracks (TV only): Go to Plex -> Settings -> Webhooks -> add Overr-Syncerr URL
  • Improved logging: removed redundant and excessive logging; you can now see an estimate of how long it will take for chunks to be translated (GPT)
  • Improved messaging: better messaging based on user locale (Overseerr/Jellyseerr) when reporting an issue
  • Plex host and token are now optional: if you're using Jellyfin instead of Plex and want to only manage subtitles, you can comment out both variables ( #25 )

entry.title: New release for Overr-Syncerr: v1.0.6.6
entry.content:
BREAKING CHANGES

It's recommended to backup/remove existing user_tokens.json and user_subs_pref.json and have the script generate new ones with the updated structure.

What's new

  • Support for managed accounts (home users) (#31)
  • Admin account is now included in the user_tokens.json allowing for configuration of preferred audio and subtitle tracks (#32)
  • Fixed broken subtitles fallback logic (#33) and added support for hearing impaired subtitles (see updated json structure below)

Example of new user_subs_pref.json structure:

"user1": { "preferred": [ { "forced": false, "hearingImpaired": false, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "eng" } ], "fallback": { "preferences": [ { "forced": false, "hearingImpaired": true, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "eng" } ], "enabled": true } To disable fallback entirely for a user, set enabled to false

You can add multiple preferred subtitle tracks like so:

"user1": { "preferred": [ { "forced": false, "hearingImpaired": false, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "eng" }, { "forced": true, "hearingImpaired": false, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "spa" } ], "fallback": { "preferences": [ { "forced": false, "hearingImpaired": false, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "jpn" }, { "forced": false, "hearingImpaired": true, "codec": "srt", "languageCode": "dan" } ], "enabled": true }
